Retrieves glyphs used to display labels on a map

Source: R/locationservice_operations.R
locationservice_get_map_glyphs.Rd

Retrieves glyphs used to display labels on a map.

locationservice_get_map_glyphs(FontStack, FontUnicodeRange, MapName)

Arguments

FontStack

[required] A comma-separated list of fonts to load glyphs from in order of preference. For example, Noto Sans Regular, Arial Unicode.

Valid fonts stacks for Esri styles:

  • VectorEsriDarkGrayCanvas – Ubuntu Medium Italic | Ubuntu Medium | Ubuntu Italic | Ubuntu Regular | Ubuntu Bold

  • VectorEsriLightGrayCanvas – Ubuntu Italic | Ubuntu Regular | Ubuntu Light | Ubuntu Bold

  • VectorEsriTopographic – Noto Sans Italic | Noto Sans Regular | Noto Sans Bold | Noto Serif Regular | Roboto Condensed Light Italic

  • VectorEsriStreets – Arial Regular | Arial Italic | Arial Bold

  • VectorEsriNavigation – Arial Regular | Arial Italic | Arial Bold

Valid font stacks for HERE Technologies styles:

  • VectorHereContrast – Fira GO Regular | Fira GO Bold

  • VectorHereExplore, VectorHereExploreTruck – Firo GO Italic | Fira GO Map | Fira GO Map Bold | Noto Sans CJK JP Bold | Noto Sans CJK JP Light | Noto Sans CJK JP Regular

FontUnicodeRange

[required] A Unicode range of characters to download glyphs for. Each response will contain 256 characters. For example, 0–255 includes all characters from range U+0000 to 00FF. Must be aligned to multiples of 256.

MapName

[required] The map resource associated with the glyph ﬁle.

Value

A list with the following syntax:

list(
  Blob = raw,
  ContentType = "string"
)

Request syntax

svc$get_map_glyphs(
  FontStack = "string",
  FontUnicodeRange = "string",
  MapName = "string"
)

Contents
